history.text: I think Zootopia would be a great family movie to watch with the kids.
Oh really? Why is that? Is it fun and carefree?
Yeah, looks like it would be cute. A bunny (Judy Hopps) has always wanted to be a police office, and was valedictorian of her class. She got stuck with parking duty instead.
First day on the job she got hustled by a con artist.
The reviews are great! It's so hard to find good movies for adults and kids.
Does she eventually succeed? Does it teach children about perserverence?
Are there fun jokes mixed in for adults?
I haven't seen it yet so I'm not honestly sure.
Well, I'm sure it has a happy ending if the reviews are very good. Do you know who voices the characters?
But from what I understand it has a great lesson about not judging people and stereotypes.
THat is a very good lesson for everyone to learn
Officer Judy Hopps is Ginnifer Goodwin.
Oh, I enjoy her other works. I'm sure she did a good job here too. Are there other main characters?
Jason Bateman is Nick, the con fox.
Do they provide his backstory as to why he's a con?
Idris Elba and Jenny Slate are also in it. I'm not familiar with them.
Neither am I. Perhaps it will be their big break
He was bullied as a kid and and stereotyped for being a con because he was a fox.
Ah, so it plays into the stereotype theme.
Do you know what studio produces this film?
In the end Judy and Nick get close, and she asks him to join her as her partner.
For work.
What a wonderful happy ending
Does that mean she is a full cop?
Bryon Howard and  Rich Moore directed the movie.
I haven't heard of them. Which studio?
Yeah, I think she gets out of parking duty.
I don't know which studio.
Good it will teach children that hard work pays off
When is the movie out?
The animation is supposed to be great. It came out in 2016.

uid1response.feedback: I will watch the movie because I enjoy cute animated movies. However, I felt the conversation did not go smoothly and the other user just provided facts to me, whether or not they were prompted. They did answer questions when I asked them.
